alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 17 at 7:40AM AKST until November 17 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Visibility reduced to one half mile at times. * WHERE...Western Kenai Peninsula, mainly north of Ninilchik. * WHEN...Until noon AKST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bands of moderate to heavy snow are moving south across the western Kenai Peninsula this morning. Expect snowfall rates of one to two inches per hour with these bands along with visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. Driving along the Sterling Highway between Kasilof and Sterling may be difficult at times due to the combination of snowfall and snow kicked up due to vehicular traffic.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
